info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 8:27PM CDT until June 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JONES AND NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR COUNTIES... At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Impact, or near Hawley, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Abilene and Nugent around 835 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Impact, Hodges, Lake Fort Phantom Hill, Stith and Truby. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 275 and 288. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
